text.section: To qualify for a license to practice speech-language pathology, an applicant shall be an individual who meets the requirements of this section.
The applicant shall be of good moral character.

The applicant shall:
Hold a master's degree in the area of speech-language pathology from an educational institution which incorporates the academic course work and the minimum hours of supervised training required by the regulations adopted by the Board; and
Have completed the period of supervised postgraduate professional practice in speech-language pathology as specified by the regulations adopted by the Board.
Except as otherwise provided in this title, the applicant shall pass an examination in speech-language pathology as required by regulations adopted by the Board.
The applicant shall demonstrate oral competency.
